projectPurpose: To provide a Rust library for hooking into and observing the execution of the Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM), specifically the `revm` implementation, enabling detailed analysis and debugging.
mainFeatures: Allows low-level observation of EVM execution
Enables building custom analysis and debugging tools

alternatives.name: Geth (Go-Ethereum)
mainFeatures: Provides debug_traceTransaction and other tracing APIs
Widely used for interacting with the Ethereum network

alternatives.name: Foundry
mainFeatures: Fast EVM development toolkit in Rust
Forge test framework with built-in debugger

alternatives.name: Tevm
mainFeatures: EVM execution hooks at opcode level
Direct Solidity imports with type safety

marketPositioning: evm-inspectors is positioned as a low-level Rust library providing granular access to EVM execution via hooks within the `revm` environment. Unlike higher-level debugging tools or full node clients, it focuses on enabling developers building custom EVM analysis tools, debuggers, and simulations in Rust to intercept and observe opcode-level execution directly. It serves a specific niche within the Rust-based Ethereum development ecosystem, acting as a foundational component for more complex tooling.
